availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaiah Michael Doughman (Hamilton County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, blacksmith and soldier. Married to Margaret Cowen Doughman in Clermont County, Ohio, on August 3, 1851. Father of Elijah Doughman, Adeline Doughman, William Doughman, and Harriett Doughman. Blacksmith in Hamilton County in 1860. Employed Hugh Taylor as a wagon maker in Hamilton County in 1860. Served in the 79th Ohio Infantry as a first lieutenant.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hamilton County, Warren, p. 54.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Union County, Warren, p. 574A.
Ohio Marriage Records, various courthouses, Clermont County Marriages, 1844-1855, Film #000327561, p. 307.
Index to Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Ohio, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M552, Roll 28.
Find A Grave, "Isaiah Michael Doughman (1826-1900)," Memorial 44842065, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44842065 (accessed June 10, 2020).
KYR-0001-004-1386.
